DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Coordinator Study Site Research Personnel Role Role Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person who handles the administrative responsibilities of a study on behalf of a study site, acts as a liaison between the study site and the study investigator and/or study sponsor, and reviews all data and records before a monitor's visit. EXAMPLE(S): trial coordinator, study coordinator, research coordinator, clinical coordinator, research nurse, protocol nurse. OTHER NAME(S): At some sites (primarily in academic settings) StudySiteResearchCoordinators are called Clinical Research Coordinators or Clinical Research Associates (CRAs). The coded value specifying a type of responsibility of the study site personnel. EXAMPLE(S): Principal Investigator, Sub Investigator, Facility.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Coordinator Study Site Research Personnel Role Role Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person to whom a clinical investigator delegates a few of the routine administrative requirements of a protocol. The duties and responsibilities of a clinical research coordinator may vary across different infrastructures. Generally, the coordinator manages the subject's clinical trial participation and provides a vital linkage between the subject, the investigator, and the sponsor.:A facility in which study/protocol activities are conducted.:People engaged in research.:The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event._The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event.:A system, often of numbered categories, used for representation of data.
